trans-unit.source: Apps use background tasks and two main mechanisms to maintain communications when they are not in the foreground: The socket broker, and control channel triggers.
trans-unit.target: Apps use background tasks and two main mechanisms to maintain communications when they are not in the foreground: The socket broker, and control channel triggers.

trans-unit.source: Apps that use sockets can delegate ownership of a socket to a system socket broker when they leave the foreground.
trans-unit.target: Apps that use sockets can delegate ownership of a socket to a system socket broker when they leave the foreground.

trans-unit.source: The broker then activates the app when traffic arrives on the socket, transfers ownership back to the app, and the app processes the arriving traffic.
trans-unit.target: The broker then activates the app when traffic arrives on the socket, transfers ownership back to the app, and the app processes the arriving traffic.

trans-unit.source: Socket broker and the SocketActivityTrigger
trans-unit.target: Socket broker and the SocketActivityTrigger

trans-unit.source: If your app uses [**DatagramSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319), [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), or [**StreamSocketListener**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226906) connections, then you should use [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009) and the socket broker to be notified when traffic arrives for your app while it's not in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: If your app uses [**DatagramSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319), [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), or [**StreamSocketListener**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226906) connections, then you should use [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009) and the socket broker to be notified when traffic arrives for your app while it's not in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: In order for your app to receive and process data received on a socket when your app is not active, your app must perform some one-time setup at startup, and then transfer socket ownership to the socket broker when it is transitioning to a state where it is not active.
trans-unit.target: In order for your app to receive and process data received on a socket when your app is not active, your app must perform some one-time setup at startup, and then transfer socket ownership to the socket broker when it is transitioning to a state where it is not active.

trans-unit.source: Control channel triggers
trans-unit.target: Control channel triggers

trans-unit.source: First, ensure that you're using control channel triggers (CCTs) appropriately.
trans-unit.target: First, ensure that you're using control channel triggers (CCTs) appropriately.

trans-unit.source: If you're using [**DatagramSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319), [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), or [**StreamSocketListener**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226906) connections, we recommend you use [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009).
trans-unit.target: If you're using [**DatagramSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319), [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), or [**StreamSocketListener**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226906) connections, we recommend you use [**SocketActivityTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009).

trans-unit.source: You can use CCTs for **StreamSocket**, but they use more resources and might not work in Connected Standby mode.
trans-unit.target: You can use CCTs for **StreamSocket**, but they use more resources and might not work in Connected Standby mode.

trans-unit.source: If you are using WebSockets, [**IXMLHTTPRequest2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831151), [**System.Net.Http.HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) or **Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient**, you must use [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
trans-unit.target: If you are using WebSockets, [**IXMLHTTPRequest2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831151), [**System.Net.Http.HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) or **Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient**, you must use [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).

trans-unit.source: ControlChannelTrigger with WebSockets
trans-unit.target: ControlChannelTrigger with WebSockets

trans-unit.source: Some special considerations apply when using [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) or [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
trans-unit.target: Some special considerations apply when using [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) or [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).

trans-unit.source: There are some transport-specific usage patterns and best practices that should be followed when using a **MessageWebSocket** or **StreamWebSocket** with **ControlChannelTrigger**.
trans-unit.target: There are some transport-specific usage patterns and best practices that should be followed when using a **MessageWebSocket** or **StreamWebSocket** with **ControlChannelTrigger**.

trans-unit.source: In addition, these considerations affect the way that requests to receive packets on the **StreamWebSocket** are handled.
trans-unit.target: In addition, these considerations affect the way that requests to receive packets on the **StreamWebSocket** are handled.

trans-unit.source: Requests to receive packets on the **MessageWebSocket** are not affected.
trans-unit.target: Requests to receive packets on the **MessageWebSocket** are not affected.

trans-unit.source: The following usage patterns and best practices should be followed when using [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) or [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032):
trans-unit.target: The following usage patterns and best practices should be followed when using [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) or [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032):

trans-unit.source: An outstanding socket receive must be kept posted at all times.
trans-unit.target: An outstanding socket receive must be kept posted at all times.

trans-unit.source: This is required to allow the push notification tasks to occur.
trans-unit.target: This is required to allow the push notification tasks to occur.

trans-unit.source: The WebSocket protocol defines a standard model for keep-alive messages.
trans-unit.target: The WebSocket protocol defines a standard model for keep-alive messages.

trans-unit.source: The [**WebSocketKeepAlive**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701531) class can send client-initiated WebSocket protocol keep-alive messages to the server.
trans-unit.target: The [**WebSocketKeepAlive**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701531) class can send client-initiated WebSocket protocol keep-alive messages to the server.

trans-unit.source: The **WebSocketKeepAlive** class should be registered as the TaskEntryPoint for a KeepAliveTrigger by the app.
trans-unit.target: The **WebSocketKeepAlive** class should be registered as the TaskEntryPoint for a KeepAliveTrigger by the app.

trans-unit.source: Some special considerations affect the way that requests to receive packets on the [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) are handled.
trans-unit.target: Some special considerations affect the way that requests to receive packets on the [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) are handled.

trans-unit.source: In particular, when using a **StreamWebSocket** with the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032), your app must use a raw async pattern for handling reads instead of the **await** model in C# and VB.NET or Tasks in C++.
trans-unit.target: In particular, when using a **StreamWebSocket** with the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032), your app must use a raw async pattern for handling reads instead of the **await** model in C# and VB.NET or Tasks in C++.

trans-unit.source: The raw async pattern is illustrated in a code sample later in this section.
trans-unit.target: The raw async pattern is illustrated in a code sample later in this section.

trans-unit.source: Using the raw async pattern allows Windows to synchronize the [**IBackgroundTask.Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method on the background task for the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) with the return of the receive completion callback.
trans-unit.target: Using the raw async pattern allows Windows to synchronize the [**IBackgroundTask.Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method on the background task for the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) with the return of the receive completion callback.

trans-unit.source: The **Run** method is invoked after the completion callback returns.
trans-unit.target: The **Run** method is invoked after the completion callback returns.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that the app has received the data/errors before the **Run** method is invoked.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that the app has received the data/errors before the **Run** method is invoked.

trans-unit.source: It is important to note that the app has to post another read before it returns control from the completion callback.
trans-unit.target: It is important to note that the app has to post another read before it returns control from the completion callback.

trans-unit.source: It is also important to note that the [**DataReader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208119) cannot be directly used with the [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) or [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) transport since that breaks the synchronization described above.
trans-unit.target: It is also important to note that the [**DataReader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208119) cannot be directly used with the [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) or [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) transport since that breaks the synchronization described above.

trans-unit.source: It is not supported to use the [**DataReader.LoadAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208135) method directly on top of the transport.
trans-unit.target: It is not supported to use the [**DataReader.LoadAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208135) method directly on top of the transport.

trans-unit.source: Instead, the [**IBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241656) returned by the [**IInputStream.ReadAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241719) method on the [**StreamWebSocket.InputStream**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226936) property can be later passed to [**DataReader.FromBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208133) method for further processing.
trans-unit.target: Instead, the [**IBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241656) returned by the [**IInputStream.ReadAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241719) method on the [**StreamWebSocket.InputStream**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226936) property can be later passed to [**DataReader.FromBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208133) method for further processing.

trans-unit.source: The read completion handler is guaranteed to fire before the [**IBackgroundTask.Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method on the background task for the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) is invoked.
trans-unit.target: The read completion handler is guaranteed to fire before the [**IBackgroundTask.Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method on the background task for the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) is invoked.

trans-unit.source: Windows has internal synchronization to wait for an app to return from the read completion callback.
trans-unit.target: Windows has internal synchronization to wait for an app to return from the read completion callback.

trans-unit.source: The app typically quickly processes the data or the error from the [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) or [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) in the read completion callback.

trans-unit.source: The message itself is processed within the context of the **IBackgroundTask.Run** method.

trans-unit.source: Some special considerations apply when using [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
trans-unit.target: Some special considerations apply when using [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).

trans-unit.source: There are some transport-specific usage patterns and best practices that should be followed when using a [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) with **ControlChannelTrigger**.
trans-unit.target: There are some transport-specific usage patterns and best practices that should be followed when using a [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) with **ControlChannelTrigger**.

trans-unit.source: In addition, these considerations affect the way that requests to receive packets on the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) are handled.
trans-unit.target: In addition, these considerations affect the way that requests to receive packets on the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) are handled.

trans-unit.source: **Note** [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) using SSL is not currently supported using the network trigger feature and [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
trans-unit.target: **Note** [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) using SSL is not currently supported using the network trigger feature and [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).

trans-unit.source: The following usage patterns and best practices should be followed when using [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032):
trans-unit.target: The following usage patterns and best practices should be followed when using [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032):

trans-unit.source: The app may need to set various properties and headers on the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) or [HttpClientHandler](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241638) object in the [System.Net.Http](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=227894) namespace before sending the request to the specific URI.
trans-unit.target: The app may need to set various properties and headers on the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) or [HttpClientHandler](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241638) object in the [System.Net.Http](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=227894) namespace before sending the request to the specific URI.

trans-unit.source: An app may need to make need to an initial request to test and setup the transport properly before creating the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) transport to be used with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
trans-unit.target: An app may need to make need to an initial request to test and setup the transport properly before creating the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) transport to be used with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).

trans-unit.source: Once the app determines that the transport can be properly setup, an [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) object can be configured as the transport object used with the **ControlChannelTrigger** object.
trans-unit.target: Once the app determines that the transport can be properly setup, an [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) object can be configured as the transport object used with the **ControlChannelTrigger** object.

trans-unit.source: This process is designed prevent some scenarios from breaking the connection established over the transport.
trans-unit.target: This process is designed prevent some scenarios from breaking the connection established over the transport.

trans-unit.source: Using SSL with a certificate, an app may require a dialog to be displayed for PIN entry or if there are multiple certificates to choose from.
trans-unit.target: Using SSL with a certificate, an app may require a dialog to be displayed for PIN entry or if there are multiple certificates to choose from.

trans-unit.source: Proxy authentication and server authentication may be required.
trans-unit.target: Proxy authentication and server authentication may be required.

trans-unit.source: If the proxy or server authentication expires, the connection may be closed.
trans-unit.target: If the proxy or server authentication expires, the connection may be closed.

trans-unit.source: One way an app can deal with these authentication expiration issues is to set a timer.
trans-unit.target: One way an app can deal with these authentication expiration issues is to set a timer.

trans-unit.source: When an HTTP redirect is required, it is not guaranteed that the second connection can be established reliably.
trans-unit.target: When an HTTP redirect is required, it is not guaranteed that the second connection can be established reliably.

trans-unit.source: An initial test request will ensure that the app can use the most up-to-date redirected URL before using the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) object as the transport with the **ControlChannelTrigger** object.
trans-unit.target: An initial test request will ensure that the app can use the most up-to-date redirected URL before using the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) object as the transport with the **ControlChannelTrigger** object.

trans-unit.source: Unlike other network transports, the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) object cannot be directly passed into the [**UsingTransport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701175) method of the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) object.
trans-unit.target: Unlike other network transports, the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) object cannot be directly passed into the [**UsingTransport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701175) method of the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) object.

trans-unit.source: Instead, an [HttpRequestMessage](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=259153) object must be specially constructed for use with the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) object and the **ControlChannelTrigger**.
trans-unit.target: Instead, an [HttpRequestMessage](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=259153) object must be specially constructed for use with the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) object and the **ControlChannelTrigger**.

trans-unit.source: The [HttpRequestMessage](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=259153) object is created using the [RtcRequestFactory.Create](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=259154) method.
trans-unit.target: The [HttpRequestMessage](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=259153) object is created using the [RtcRequestFactory.Create](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=259154) method.

trans-unit.source: The [HttpRequestMessage](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=259153) object that is created is then passed to **UsingTransport** method .
trans-unit.target: The [HttpRequestMessage](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=259153) object that is created is then passed to **UsingTransport** method .

trans-unit.source: The following sample shows how to construct an [HttpRequestMessage](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=259153) object for use with the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) object and the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
trans-unit.target: The following sample shows how to construct an [HttpRequestMessage](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=259153) object for use with the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) object and the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).

trans-unit.source: Some special considerations affect the way that requests to send HTTP requests on the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) to initiate receiving a response are handled.
trans-unit.target: Some special considerations affect the way that requests to send HTTP requests on the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) to initiate receiving a response are handled.

trans-unit.source: In particular, when using a [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) with the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032), your app must use a Task for handling sends instead of the **await** model.
trans-unit.target: In particular, when using a [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) with the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032), your app must use a Task for handling sends instead of the **await** model.

trans-unit.source: Using [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637), there is no synchronization with the [**IBackgroundTask.Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method on the background task for the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) with the return of the receive completion callback.
trans-unit.target: Using [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637), there is no synchronization with the [**IBackgroundTask.Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method on the background task for the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) with the return of the receive completion callback.

trans-unit.source: For this reason, the app can only use the blocking HttpResponseMessage technique in the **Run** method and wait until the whole response is received.
trans-unit.target: For this reason, the app can only use the blocking HttpResponseMessage technique in the **Run** method and wait until the whole response is received.

trans-unit.source: Using [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) is noticeably different from the [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) or [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) transports .
trans-unit.target: Using [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) is noticeably different from the [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) or [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) transports .

trans-unit.source: The [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) receive callback is delivered via a Task to the app since the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) code.
trans-unit.target: The [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) receive callback is delivered via a Task to the app since the [HttpClient](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) code.

trans-unit.source: This means that the **ControlChannelTrigger** push notification task will fire as soon as the data or error is dispatched to the app.
trans-unit.target: This means that the **ControlChannelTrigger** push notification task will fire as soon as the data or error is dispatched to the app.

trans-unit.source: In the sample below, the code stores the responseTask returned by [HttpClient.SendAsync](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) method into global storage that the push notify task will pick up and process inline.
trans-unit.target: In the sample below, the code stores the responseTask returned by [HttpClient.SendAsync](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241637) method into global storage that the push notify task will pick up and process inline.

trans-unit.source: Some special considerations apply when using [**IXMLHTTPRequest2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831151) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
trans-unit.target: Some special considerations apply when using [**IXMLHTTPRequest2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831151) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).

trans-unit.source: There are some transport-specific usage patterns and best practices that should be followed when using a **IXMLHTTPRequest2** with **ControlChannelTrigger**.
trans-unit.target: There are some transport-specific usage patterns and best practices that should be followed when using a **IXMLHTTPRequest2** with **ControlChannelTrigger**.

trans-unit.source: Using **ControlChannelTrigger** does not affect the way that requests to send or receive HTTP requests on the **IXMLHTTPRequest2** are handled.
trans-unit.target: Using **ControlChannelTrigger** does not affect the way that requests to send or receive HTTP requests on the **IXMLHTTPRequest2** are handled.

trans-unit.source: Usage patterns and best practices when using [**IXMLHTTPRequest2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831151) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032)
trans-unit.target: Usage patterns and best practices when using [**IXMLHTTPRequest2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831151) with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032)

trans-unit.source: An [**IXMLHTTPRequest2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831151) object when used as the transport has a lifetime of only one request/response.
trans-unit.target: An [**IXMLHTTPRequest2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831151) object when used as the transport has a lifetime of only one request/response.

trans-unit.source: When used with the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) object, it is convenient to create and set up the **ControlChannelTrigger** object once and then call the [**UsingTransport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701175) method repeatedly, each time associating a new **IXMLHTTPRequest2** object.
trans-unit.target: When used with the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) object, it is convenient to create and set up the **ControlChannelTrigger** object once and then call the [**UsingTransport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701175) method repeatedly, each time associating a new **IXMLHTTPRequest2** object.

trans-unit.source: An app should delete the previous **IXMLHTTPRequest2** object before supplying a new **IXMLHTTPRequest2** object to ensure that the app does not exceed the allocated resource limits.
trans-unit.target: An app should delete the previous **IXMLHTTPRequest2** object before supplying a new **IXMLHTTPRequest2** object to ensure that the app does not exceed the allocated resource limits.

trans-unit.source: The app may need to call the [**SetProperty**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831167) and [**SetRequestHeader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831168) methods to set up the HTTP transport before calling [**Send**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831164) method.
trans-unit.target: The app may need to call the [**SetProperty**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831167) and [**SetRequestHeader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831168) methods to set up the HTTP transport before calling [**Send**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831164) method.

trans-unit.target: An app may need to make need to an initial [**Send**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh831164) request to test and setup the transport properly before creating the transport to be used with [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
